column4: can anybody help? - have no sound and can't start the sound-settings-applet after an unclean shutdown
and found a bounch of errors
it fixed them but after reboot no sound.... :)
does anybody know what to do to bring the sound and the sound settings back? i'm on ubuntu 9.04
though your best bet may be to reinstall your desktop manager due to your unclean shutdown.
then you can type: alsamixer in your terminal and see if ubuntu is recognizing your sound card. More than likely it will.
thanks, sorry for the stupid question (not much of an expert yet) - reinstalling the desktop manager wouldn't affect somehow my files and etc..?
As with any system changes, backing up your data is a good thing. In this case its okay to just reinstall your desktop manager without worrying your files will be affected.
Hmm. Try running Ubuntu from the live cd, if the sound works from there, you could just try to reload altogether.
what does it mean to reload altogether?
Else you could try to troubleshoot.
do you have the medibuntu packages installed?
try running the live cd to make sure your sound card is functioning. You may have to install, some packages for the mp3 to work.
hmm. Multiple desktop managers will not affect your sound.
you may want to download the latest ISO from ubuntu.com.
